description: DEMOLITION OF GYMNASIUM, CONSERVATORY AND BOILER HOUSE, AND ERECTION OF  SINGLE STOREY EXTENSIONS TO REAR AND SIDES OF THE PROPERTY. FIRST AND SECOND FLOOR EXTENSION TO THE REAR WITH BASEMENT LEVEL INCORPORATING SWIMMING POOL AND ASSOCIATED ALTERATIONS.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Fire Safety Report; Arboricultural Report amended 21.10.2022; Basement Impact Assessment; Design and Assessment Statement and Demolition Statement; Drainage Strategy; Heritage Statement; PL-020 Rev 09; PL-021 Rev 10; PL-022 Rev 10; PL-023 Rev 08; PL-024 Rev 12; PL-05A Rev 06; PL-05 Rev 08; PL-08 Rev 07; PL-08 Rev 07 (left elevation); PL-06 Rev 06; PL-07 Rev 06; PL-027 Rev 05; PL-026 Rev 07; DM-012 Rev 03; DM-13 Rev 02; DM-014 Rev 02; DM-05 Rev 04; DM-011 Rev 03; DM-09 Rev 02; DM-08 Rev 03; DM-010 Rev 03; PL-029 Rev 05; & 3D Visualisation.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - ï¿½Site supervision: The details of the Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to supervise, monitor and report to the LPA not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the construction period. At the conclusion of the construction period the arboricultural expert shall submit to the LPA a satisfactory completion statement to demonstrate compliance with the approved protection measures.

Condition : 5 - Landscaping: The 3 Silver Birch trees shown on drawing number 'PL-029 Rev.05' shall be carried out as approved in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development or removed or
become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of the same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. 

Reason: To enhance the visual amenity of the local area. To comply with Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS13 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011 and Policy DM O2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of development, the applicant shall submit a detailed proposal and methodology on how drainage and groundwater will be managed and mitigated during construction (dewatering) and post construction (permanent phase) to ensure no increase in risk on or off site.

Reason: To ensure groundwater and flood risk does not increase on or offsite in accordance with Policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS16 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011 and Policy DM F2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of development, a construction level detail final scheme for the provision of surface and foul water drainage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The drainage scheme will dispose of surface water by means of a sustainable drainage system (SuDS) limited to a greenfield rate of no more than 2l/s in accordance with drainage hierarchy contained within the London Plan Policy SI 13 and the advice contained within the National SuDS Standards. The required final drainage details shall include:
1. The results of any infiltration testing completed in accordance with BRE Digest: 365 and confirmation of groundwater levels.
2. Evidence that the proposed final solution will effectively manage the 1 in 30 & 1 in 100 +40% allowance for climate change) storm events and 10% for urban creep during all stages of the development. The final solution should follow the principles set out in the approved drainage strategy. Discharge rates and storage volumes shall be provided using a maximum site wide discharge rate of 2l/
3. Detailed drainage design drawings and calculations to include: a finalised drainage layout detailing the location of drainage elements, pipe diameters, levels, and long and cross sections of each element including details of any flow restrictions and maintenance/risk reducing features (silt traps, inspection chambers etc.).
4. A plan showing exceedance flows (i.e. during rainfall greater than design events or during blockage) and how property on and off site will be protected from increased flood risk.
5. Details of drainage management responsibilities and maintenance regimes for the drainage system.
6. Details of how the drainage system will be protected during construction and how runoff (including any pollutants) from the development site will be managed before the drainage system is operational.

Reason: To reduce the risk of surface and foul water flooding to the proposed development and

Condition : 8 - Prior to commencement of development material samples for all new external surfaces including all roofs and dormer window(s) are to be submitted and approved in wrting to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the conservation area. To comply with Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM D4 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 9 - Prior to commencemnt of development details of the new chimney shall be submitted to and approved
in writing to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the conservation area. To comply with Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM D4 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 10 - Prior to commencement of development details of all new windows and doors (including cross-sections and elevation drawings at 1:20) shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the conservation area. To comply with Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM D4 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 11 - A method statement regarding the construction of the basement, including detail as to how the
works will be carried out without compromising the structural integrity of the existing dwelling,
shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to the commencement of the related works.

Reason: In the interests of good design. To comply with Policy D4 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS14 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011 and Policy DM D1 and DM D2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the side elevations at first floor level and above shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 13 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 14 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.

Condition : 15 - No surface water runoff should discharge onto the public highway including the public footway or highway. When it is proposed to connect to a public sewer, the site drainage should be separate and combined at the final manhole nearest the boundary. Where the developer proposes to discharge to a public sewer, prior approval from Thames Water Developer Services will be required (contact no. 0845 850 2777). No waste material, including concrete, mortar, grout, plaster, fats, oils and chemicals shall be washed down on the highway or disposed of into the highway drainage system.
